original_title: Sri Lanka’s Export Development Board to host SME promoting open day
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Export Development Board (EDB) will host an open day on June 15 at its premises in capital Colombo to promote small and medium enterprises, an official said.
“The event is held in order to facilitate and promote small and medium enterprises in the country,” the EDB official told EconomyNext.

The event is opened to potential investors and is expected to educate the participants on export procedures while giving an opportunity for business representatives to meet with EDB officials and gain knowledge on exporting, the ED said in a statement separately.

“The main reason we are holding this event is because of the lack of knowledge with regard to export services and we want an even spread of knowledge for all entrepreneurs, as it is for the betterment of business and the country,” the EDB official said.
The event also gives participants an opportunity to register for EDB services such as the Women Development Programme and the New Exporter Development Programme, EDB said.
Some of the key products and services of the EDB consist of Ceylon Tea, Rubber and rubber-based products and wellness tourism, it said.
